data-discussion-id="6431x_1T2020_discussion_ch6-s7-tab5_discussion" data-user-create-comment="true" data-user-create-subcomment="true" data-read-only="false"> <div class="discussion-module-header"> <h3 class="hd hd-3 discussion-module-title">Discussion</h3> <div class="inline-discussion-topic"><span class="inline-discussion-topic-title">Topic:</span> Unit 4: Discrete random variables:Problem Set 4 / 5. Indicator variables </div> </div> <button class="discussion-show btn" data-discussion-id="6431x_1T2020_discussion_ch6-s7-tab5_discussion" > <span class="button-text">Show Discussion</span> </button> </div> <script type="text/javascript"> var $$course_id = "course\u002Dv1:MITx+6.431x+1T2020"; function DiscussionInlineBlock(runtime, element) { 'use strict'; var el = $(element).find('.discussion-module'); new DiscussionInlineView({ el: el, readOnly: el.data('read-only') }); } </script> </div> </div> </div> </div>
<div class="course-expiration-message"><strong>Audit Access Expires <span class="localized-datetime" data-format="shortDate" data-datetime="2020-05-27" data-language="en">May 27, 2020</span></strong><br>You lose all access to this course, including your progress, on <span class="localized-datetime" data-format="shortDate" data-datetime="2020-05-27" data-language="en">May 27, 2020</span>.</div> <div class="xblock xblock-student_view xblock-student_view-vertical" data-course-id="course-v1:MITx+6.431x+1T2020" data-init="VerticalStudentView" data-block-type="vertical" data-runtime-class="LmsRuntime" data-graded="True" data-has-score="False" data-usage-id="block-v1:MITx+6.431x+1T2020+type@vertical+block@ch6-s7-tab6" data-request-token="33238a069be111eab73e0a9bb1fdf541" data-runtime-version="1"> <h2 class="hd hd-2 unit-title">6. True or False</h2> <div class="bookmark-button-wrapper"> <button class="btn btn-link bookmark-button " aria-pressed="false" data-bookmark-id="SY0628,block-v1:MITx+6.431x+1T2020+type@vertical+block@ch6-s7-tab6" data-bookmarks-api-url="/api/bookmarks/v1/bookmarks/"> <span class="bookmark-text">Bookmark this page</span> </button> </div> <div class="vert-mod"> <div class="vert vert-0" data-id="block-v1:MITx+6.431x+1T2020+type@problem+block@hw4-tab6-problem6"> <div class="xblock xblock-student_view xblock-student_view-problem xmodule_display xmodule_ProblemBlock" data-course-id="course-v1:MITx+6.431x+1T2020" data-init="XBlockToXModuleShim" data-block-type="problem" data-runtime-class="LmsRuntime" data-graded="True" data-has-score="True" data-usage-id="block-v1:MITx+6.431x+1T2020+type@problem+block@hw4-tab6-problem6" data-request-token="33238a069be111eab73e0a9bb1fdf541" data-runtime-version="1"> <script type="json/xblock-args" class="xblock-json-init-args"> {"xmodule-type": "Problem"} </script> <div id="problem_hw4-tab6-problem6" class="problems-wrapper" role="group" aria-labelledby="hw4-tab6-problem6-problem-title" data-problem-id="block-v1:MITx+6.431x+1T2020+type@problem+block@hw4-tab6-problem6" data-url="/courses/course-v1:MITx+6.431x+1T2020/xblock/block-v1:MITx+6.431x+1T2020+type@problem+block@hw4-tab6-problem6/handler/xmodule_handler" data-problem-score="6" data-problem-total-possible="8" data-attempts-used="1" data-content=" &lt;h3 class=&#34;hd hd-3 problem-header&#34; id=&#34;hw4-tab6-problem6-problem-title&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;block-v1:MITx+6.431x+1T2020+type@problem+block@hw4-tab6-problem6-problem-progress&#34; tabindex=&#34;-1&#34;&gt; Problem 6. True or False &lt;/h3&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;problem-progress&#34; id=&#34;block-v1:MITx+6.431x+1T2020+type@problem+block@hw4-tab6-problem6-problem-progress&#34;&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;problem&#34;&gt; &lt;div&gt; &lt;p&gt; For each of the following statements, state whether it is true (meaning, always true) or false (meaning, not always true): &lt;/p&gt; &lt;ol class=&#34;enumerate&#34;&gt; &lt;li value=&#34;1&#34;&gt; &lt;p&gt; Let [mathjaxinline]X[/mathjaxinline] and [mathjaxinline]Y[/mathjaxinline] be two binomial random variables. &lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt; (a) If [mathjaxinline]X[/mathjaxinline] and [mathjaxinline]Y[/mathjaxinline] are independent, then [mathjaxinline]X+Y[/mathjaxinline] is also a binomial random variable. &lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;wrapper-problem-response&#34; tabindex=&#34;-1&#34; aria-label=&#34;Question 1&#34; role=&#34;group&#34;&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;inputtype option-input &#34;&gt; &lt;select name=&#34;input_hw4-tab6-problem6_2_1&#34; id=&#34;input_hw4-tab6-problem6_2_1&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;status_hw4-tab6-problem6_2_1&#34;&gt; &lt;option value=&#34;option_hw4-tab6-problem6_2_1_dummy_default&#34;&gt;Select an option&lt;/option&gt; &lt;option value=&#34;True&#34;&gt; True&lt;/option&gt; &lt;option value=&#34;False&#34; selected=&#34;true&#34;&gt; False&lt;/option&gt; &lt;/select&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;indicator-container&#34;&gt; &lt;span class=&#34;status correct&#34; id=&#34;status_hw4-tab6-problem6_2_1&#34; data-tooltip=&#34;This answer is correct.&#34;&gt; &lt;span class=&#34;sr&#34;&gt;correct&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;status-icon&#34; aria-hidden=&#34;true&#34;/&gt; &lt;/span&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;p class=&#34;answer&#34; id=&#34;answer_hw4-tab6-problem6_2_1&#34;/&gt; &lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt; (b) If [mathjaxinline]X[/mathjaxinline] and [mathjaxinline]Y[/mathjaxinline] have the same parameters, [mathjaxinline]n[/mathjaxinline] and [mathjaxinline]p[/mathjaxinline], then [mathjaxinline]X+Y[/mathjaxinline] is a binomial random variable. &lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;wrapper-problem-response&#34; tabindex=&#34;-1&#34; aria-label=&#34;Question 2&#34; role=&#34;group&#34;&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;inputtype option-input &#34;&gt; &lt;select name=&#34;input_hw4-tab6-problem6_3_1&#34; id=&#34;input_hw4-tab6-problem6_3_1&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;status_hw4-tab6-problem6_3_1&#34;&gt; &lt;option value=&#34;option_hw4-tab6-problem6_3_1_dummy_default&#34;&gt;Select an option&lt;/option&gt; &lt;option value=&#34;True&#34; selected=&#34;true&#34;&gt; True&lt;/option&gt; &lt;option value=&#34;False&#34;&gt; False&lt;/option&gt; &lt;/select&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;indicator-container&#34;&gt; &lt;span class=&#34;status incorrect&#34; id=&#34;status_hw4-tab6-problem6_3_1&#34; data-tooltip=&#34;This answer is incorrect.&#34;&gt; &lt;span class=&#34;sr&#34;&gt;incorrect&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;status-icon&#34; aria-hidden=&#34;true&#34;/&gt; &lt;/span&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;p class=&#34;answer&#34; id=&#34;answer_hw4-tab6-problem6_3_1&#34;/&gt; &lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt; (c) If [mathjaxinline]X[/mathjaxinline] and [mathjaxinline]Y[/mathjaxinline] have the same parameter [mathjaxinline]p[/mathjaxinline], and are independent, then [mathjaxinline]X+Y[/mathjaxinline] is a binomial random variable. &lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;wrapper-problem-response&#34; tabindex=&#34;-1&#34; aria-label=&#34;Question 3&#34; role=&#34;group&#34;&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;inputtype option-input &#34;&gt; &lt;select name=&#34;input_hw4-tab6-problem6_4_1&#34; id=&#34;input_hw4-tab6-problem6_4_1&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;status_hw4-tab6-problem6_4_1&#34;&gt; &lt;option value=&#34;option_hw4-tab6-problem6_4_1_dummy_default&#34;&gt;Select an option&lt;/option&gt; &lt;option value=&#34;True&#34; selected=&#34;true&#34;&gt; True&lt;/option&gt; &lt;option value=&#34;False&#34;&gt; False&lt;/option&gt; &lt;/select&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;indicator-container&#34;&gt; &lt;span class=&#34;status correct&#34; id=&#34;status_hw4-tab6-problem6_4_1&#34; data-tooltip=&#34;This answer is correct.&#34;&gt; &lt;span class=&#34;sr&#34;&gt;correct&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;status-icon&#34; aria-hidden=&#34;true&#34;/&gt; &lt;/span&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;p class=&#34;answer&#34; id=&#34;answer_hw4-tab6-problem6_4_1&#34;/&gt; &lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;/p&gt; &lt;/li&gt; &lt;li value=&#34;2&#34;&gt; &lt;p&gt; Suppose that, [mathjaxinline]{\bf E}[X]=0[/mathjaxinline]. Then, [mathjaxinline]X=0[/mathjaxinline]. &lt;div class=&#34;wrapper-problem-response&#34; tabindex=&#34;-1&#34; aria-label=&#34;Question 4&#34; role=&#34;group&#34;&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;inputtype option-input &#34;&gt; &lt;select name=&#34;input_hw4-tab6-problem6_5_1&#34; id=&#34;input_hw4-tab6-problem6_5_1&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;status_hw4-tab6-problem6_5_1&#34;&gt; &lt;option value=&#34;option_hw4-tab6-problem6_5_1_dummy_default&#34;&gt;Select an option&lt;/option&gt; &lt;option value=&#34;True&#34;&gt; True&lt;/option&gt; &lt;option value=&#34;False&#34; selected=&#34;true&#34;&gt; False&lt;/option&gt; &lt;/select&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;indicator-container&#34;&gt; &lt;span class=&#34;status correct&#34; id=&#34;status_hw4-tab6-problem6_5_1&#34; data-tooltip=&#34;This answer is correct.&#34;&gt; &lt;span class=&#34;sr&#34;&gt;correct&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;status-icon&#34; aria-hidden=&#34;true&#34;/&gt; &lt;/span&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;p class=&#34;answer&#34; id=&#34;answer_hw4-tab6-problem6_5_1&#34;/&gt; &lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;/p&gt; &lt;/li&gt; &lt;li value=&#34;3&#34;&gt; &lt;p&gt; Suppose that, [mathjaxinline]{\bf E}[X^2]=0[/mathjaxinline]. Then, [mathjaxinline]\mathbf{P}(X=0)=1[/mathjaxinline]. &lt;div class=&#34;wrapper-problem-response&#34; tabindex=&#34;-1&#34; aria-label=&#34;Question 5&#34; role=&#34;group&#34;&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;inputtype option-input &#34;&gt; &lt;select name=&#34;input_hw4-tab6-problem6_6_1&#34; id=&#34;input_hw4-tab6-problem6_6_1&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;status_hw4-tab6-problem6_6_1&#34;&gt; &lt;option value=&#34;option_hw4-tab6-problem6_6_1_dummy_default&#34;&gt;Select an option&lt;/option&gt; &lt;option value=&#34;True&#34; selected=&#34;true&#34;&gt; True&lt;/option&gt; &lt;option value=&#34;False&#34;&gt; False&lt;/option&gt; &lt;/select&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;indicator-container&#34;&gt; &lt;span class=&#34;status correct&#34; id=&#34;status_hw4-tab6-problem6_6_1&#34; data-tooltip=&#34;This answer is correct.&#34;&gt; &lt;span class=&#34;sr&#34;&gt;correct&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;status-icon&#34; aria-hidden=&#34;true&#34;/&gt; &lt;/span&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;p class=&#34;answer&#34; id=&#34;answer_hw4-tab6-problem6_6_1&#34;/&gt; &lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;/p&gt; &lt;/li&gt; &lt;li value=&#34;4&#34;&gt; &lt;p&gt; Let [mathjaxinline]X[/mathjaxinline] be a random variable. Then, [mathjaxinline]{\bf E}[X^2] \geq {\bf E}[X][/mathjaxinline]. &lt;div class=&#34;wrapper-problem-response&#34; tabindex=&#34;-1&#34; aria-label=&#34;Question 6&#34; role=&#34;group&#34;&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;inputtype option-input &#34;&gt; &lt;select name=&#34;input_hw4-tab6-problem6_7_1&#34; id=&#34;input_hw4-tab6-problem6_7_1&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;status_hw4-tab6-problem6_7_1&#34;&gt; &lt;option value=&#34;option_hw4-tab6-problem6_7_1_dummy_default&#34;&gt;Select an option&lt;/option&gt; &lt;option value=&#34;True&#34; selected=&#34;true&#34;&gt; True&lt;/option&gt; &lt;option value=&#34;False&#34;&gt; False&lt;/option&gt; &lt;/select&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;indicator-container&#34;&gt; &lt;span class=&#34;status incorrect&#34; id=&#34;status_hw4-tab6-problem6_7_1&#34; data-tooltip=&#34;This answer is incorrect.&#34;&gt; &lt;span class=&#34;sr&#34;&gt;incorrect&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;status-icon&#34; aria-hidden=&#34;true&#34;/&gt; &lt;/span&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;p class=&#34;answer&#34; id=&#34;answer_hw4-tab6-problem6_7_1&#34;/&gt; &lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;/p&gt; &lt;/li&gt; &lt;li value=&#34;5&#34;&gt; &lt;p&gt; Suppose that, [mathjaxinline]X[/mathjaxinline] is a random variable, taking positive integer values, which satisfies [mathjaxinline]{\bf E}[(X-6)^2]=0[/mathjaxinline]. Then, [mathjaxinline]p_ X(4)=p_ X(5)[/mathjaxinline]. &lt;div class=&#34;wrapper-problem-response&#34; tabindex=&#34;-1&#34; aria-label=&#34;Question 7&#34; role=&#34;group&#34;&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;inputtype option-input &#34;&gt; &lt;select name=&#34;input_hw4-tab6-problem6_8_1&#34; id=&#34;input_hw4-tab6-problem6_8_1&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;status_hw4-tab6-problem6_8_1&#34;&gt; &lt;option value=&#34;option_hw4-tab6-problem6_8_1_dummy_default&#34;&gt;Select an option&lt;/option&gt; &lt;option value=&#34;True&#34; selected=&#34;true&#34;&gt; True&lt;/option&gt; &lt;option value=&#34;False&#34;&gt; False&lt;/option&gt; &lt;/select&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;indicator-container&#34;&gt; &lt;span class=&#34;status correct&#34; id=&#34;status_hw4-tab6-problem6_8_1&#34; data-tooltip=&#34;This answer is correct.&#34;&gt; &lt;span class=&#34;sr&#34;&gt;correct&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;status-icon&#34; aria-hidden=&#34;true&#34;/&gt; &lt;/span&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;p class=&#34;answer&#34; id=&#34;answer_hw4-tab6-problem6_8_1&#34;/&gt; &lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;/p&gt; &lt;/li&gt; &lt;li value=&#34;6&#34;&gt; &lt;p&gt; Suppose that [mathjaxinline]{\bf E}[X] \geq 0[/mathjaxinline]. Then, [mathjaxinline]X \geq 0[/mathjaxinline] with probability 1, i.e., [mathjaxinline]\mathbf{P}(X\geq 0)=1[/mathjaxinline]. &lt;div class=&#34;wrapper-problem-response&#34; tabindex=&#34;-1&#34; aria-label=&#34;Question 8&#34; role=&#34;group&#34;&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;inputtype option-input &#34;&gt; &lt;select name=&#34;input_hw4-tab6-problem6_9_1&#34; id=&#34;input_hw4-tab6-problem6_9_1&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;status_hw4-tab6-problem6_9_1&#34;&gt; &lt;option value=&#34;option_hw4-tab6-problem6_9_1_dummy_default&#34;&gt;Select an option&lt;/option&gt; &lt;option value=&#34;True&#34;&gt; True&lt;/option&gt; &lt;option value=&#34;False&#34; selected=&#34;true&#34;&gt; False&lt;/option&gt; &lt;/select&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;indicator-container&#34;&gt; &lt;span class=&#34;status correct&#34; id=&#34;status_hw4-tab6-problem6_9_1&#34; data-tooltip=&#34;This answer is correct.&#34;&gt; &lt;span class=&#34;sr&#34;&gt;correct&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;status-icon&#34; aria-hidden=&#34;true&#34;/&gt; &lt;/span&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;p class=&#34;answer&#34; id=&#34;answer_hw4-tab6-problem6_9_1&#34;/&gt; &lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;/p&gt; &lt;/li&gt; &lt;/ol&gt; &lt;p&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;solution-span&#34;&gt; &lt;span id=&#34;solution_hw4-tab6-problem6_solution_1&#34;/&gt; &lt;/div&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;action&#34;&gt; &lt;input type=&#34;hidden&#34; name=&#34;problem_id&#34; value=&#34;Problem 6. True or False&#34; /&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;submit-attempt-container&#34;&gt; &lt;button type=&#34;button&#34; class=&#34;submit btn-brand&#34; data-submitting=&#34;Submitting&#34; data-value=&#34;Submit&#34; data-should-enable-submit-button=&#34;False&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;submission_feedback_hw4-tab6-problem6&#34; disabled&gt; &lt;span class=&#34;submit-label&#34;&gt;Submit&lt;/span&gt; &lt;/button&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;submission-feedback&#34; id=&#34;submission_feedback_hw4-tab6-problem6&#34;&gt; You have used 1 of 1 attempt &lt;span class=&#34;sr&#34;&gt;Some problems have options such as save, reset, hints, or show answer. These options follow the Submit button.&lt;/span&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;problem-action-buttons-wrapper&#34;&gt; &lt;span class=&#34;problem-action-button-wrapper&#34;&gt; &lt;button type=&#34;button&#34; class=&#34;show problem-action-btn btn-default btn-small&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;hw4-tab6-problem6-problem-title&#34;&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;icon fa fa-info-circle&#34; aria-hidden=&#34;true&#34;&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;show-label&#34;&gt;Show Answer&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/button&gt; &lt;/span&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;div languages // thread_type describes the kind of post this is (e.g. "question" or "discussion"); // time_ago is how much time has passed since the post was created (e.g. "4 hours ago") if (thread_type === 'discussion') { postedTimeAgoMessage = gettext('discussion posted %(time_ago)s by %(author)s'); } else { postedTimeAgoMessage = gettext('question posted %(time_ago)s by %(author)s'); } %> <%= /* // Translators: This is a label for a Question forum thread with a marked answer sr_text = gettext("answered question"); } else { icon_class = "fa-question"; // Translators: This is a label for a Question forum thread without a marked answer sr_text = gettext("unanswered question"); } %> <span class="sr"><%= HtmlUtils.HTML(sr_text) %></span> <span class="icon fa <%- icon_class %>" aria-hidden="true"></span> </div><div class="forum-nav-thread-wrapper-1"> <span class="forum-nav-thread-title"><%- title %></span> <% if (showThreadPreview){ %> <div class="thread-preview-body"><%- threadPreview %></div> <% } %> <% if(typeof(subscribed) === "undefined") { var subscribed = null; } %> <% if(pinned || subscribed || staff_authored || community_ta_authored) { %> <ul class="forum-nav-thread-labels"> <% if (pinned) { %> <li class="post-label post-label-pinned"> <span class="icon fa fa-thumb-tack" aria-hidden="true"></span> <% // Translators: This is a label for a forum thread that has been pinned %> <%- gettext("Pinned") %> </li> <% } %> <% if (subscribed) { %> <li class="post-label post-label-following"> <span class="icon fa fa-star" aria-hidden="true"></span> <% // Translators: This is a label for a forum thread that the user is subscribed to %> <%- gettext("Following") %> </li> <% } %> <% if (staff_authored) { %> <li class="post-label post-label-by-staff"> <span class="icon fa fa-user" aria-hidden="true"></span> <% // Translators: This is a label for a forum thread that was authored by a member of the course staff %> <%- gettext("Staff") %> </li> <% } %> <% if (community_ta_authored) { %> <li class="post-label post-label-by-community-ta"> <span class="icon fa fa-user" aria-hidden="true"></span> <% // Translators: This is a label for a forum thread that was authored by a community TA %> <%- gettext("Community TA") %> </li> <% } %> </ul> <% } %> </div><div class="forum-nav-thread-wrapper-2"> <% // Translators: 'votes_count' is a numerical placeholder for a specific discussion thread; 'span_start' and 'span_end' placeholders refer to HTML markup. Please translate the word 'votes'. var fmt = ngettext( "%(votes_count)s%(span_start)s vote %(span_end)s", "%(votes_count)s%(span_start)s votes %(span_end)s", votes['up_count'] ); %> <span class="forum-nav-thread-votes-count"> +<%= /* xss-lint: disable=underscore-not-escaped */ interpolate(fmt, { votes_count: votes['up_count'], span_start: '<span class="sr">', span_end: '</span>' }, true) %> </span> <% if (!hideReadState && !neverRead && unread_comments_count > 0) { %> <span class="forum-nav-thread-unread-comments-count"> <%- StringUtils.interpolate( gettext('{unread_comments_count} new'), {unread_comments_count: unread_comments_count} ) %> </span> <% } %> <span class="forum-nav-thread-comments-count"> <% var fmt; // Counts in data do not include the post itself, but the UI should var data = { 'span_sr_open': '<span class="sr">', 'span_close': '</span>', 'unread_comments_count': unread_comments_count + (read ? 0 : 1), 'comments_count': comments_count + 1 }; if (unread_comments_count > 0) { // Translators: 'comments_count' and 'unread_comments_count' are numerical placeholders for a specific discussion thread; 'span_*' placeholders refer to HTML markup. Please translate the word 'comments'. fmt = gettext('%(comments_count)s %(span_sr_open)scomments (%(unread_comments_count)s unread comments)%(span_close)s'); } else { // Translators: 'comments_count' is a numerical placeholder for a specific discussion thread; 'span_*' placeholders refer to HTML markup. Please translate the word 'comments'. fmt = gettext('%(comments_count)s %(span_sr_open)scomments %(span_close)s'); } print(interpolate(fmt, data, true)); %> </span> </div> </a> </li> </script> <script aria-hidden="true" type="text/template" id="search-alert-template"> <div class="search-alert <%- css_class %>" id="search-alert-<%- cid %>"> <div class="search-alert-content"> <p class="message"><%= HtmlUtils.ensureHtml(messageHtml) %></p> </div> <div class="search-alert-controls"> <button class="btn-link dismiss control control-dismiss" title="<%- gettext('Close') %>"> <span class="icon fa fa-remove" aria-hidden="true"></span> </button> </div> </div> </script> <script aria-hidden="true" type="text/template" id="new-post-template"> <form class="forum-new-post-form"> <h<%- startHeader %> class="thread-title"><%- gettext("Add a Post") %></h<%- startHeader %>> <% if (mode === 'inline') { %> <button class="btn btn-outline-primary btn-default add-post-cancel"> <span class="sr"><%- gettext('Cancel') %></span> <span class="fa fa-close" aria-hidden="true"></span> </button> <% } %> <ul class="post-errors" style="display: none"></ul> <div class="forum-new-post-form-wrapper"></div> <% if (group_options) { %> <div class="post-field group-selector-wrapper <% if (!is_commentable_divided) { print('disabled'); class="forum-content"> </div> </div> </div> </section> </script> <script aria-hidden="true" type="text/template" id="pagination-template"> <nav class="discussion-paginator"> <ol> <% if (previous) { %> <li class="previous-page"><a class="discussion-pagination" href="<%- previous.url() %>" data-page-number="<%- previous.number %>">&lt; <%- gettext("Previous") %></a></li> <% } %> <% if (first) { %> <li class="first-page"><a class="discussion-pagination" href="<%- first.url() %>" data-page-number="1">1</a></li> <% } %> <% if (leftdots) { %> <li class="previous-ellipses"><%- gettext("…") %></li> <% } %> <% _.each(lowPages, function(page) { %> <li class="lower-page"><a class="discussion-pagination" href="<%- page.url() %>" data-page-number="<%- page.number %>"><%- page.number %></a></li> <% }); %> <li class="current-page"><span><%- page %></span></li> <% _.each(highPages, function(page) { %> <li class="higher-page"><a class="discussion-pagination" href="<%- page.url() %>" data-page-number="<%- page.number %>"><%- page.number %></a></li> <% }); %> <% if (rightdots) { %> <li class="next-ellipses"><%- gettext("…") %></li> <% } %> <% if (last) { %> <li class="last-page"><a class="discussion-pagination" href="<%- last.url() %>" data-page-number="<%- last.number %>"><%- last.number %></a></li> <% } %> <% if (next) { %> <li class="next-page"><a class="discussion-pagination" href="<%- next.url() %>" data-page-number="<%- next.number %>"><%- gettext("Next") %> &gt;</a></li> <% } %> </ol> </nav> </script> <script aria-hidden="true" type="text/template" id="profile-thread-template"> <article class="discussion-article" data-id="<%- id %>"> <div class="discussion-post"> <header> <h3><%- title %></h3> <p class="posted-details"> <% %></span> <span class="post-status-closed top-post-status" style="display: none"> &bull; <%- gettext("This thread is closed.") %> </span> </p> </header> <div class="post-body"><%= HtmlUtils.HTML(abbreviatedBody) %></div> </div> <div class="post-tools"> <a href="<%- permalink %>"><%- gettext("View discussion") %></a> </div> </article> </script> <script aria-hidden="true" more") %> </button> </li> </script> <script type="text/template" id="thread-list-template"> <div class="forum-nav-thread-list-wrapper" id="sort-filter-wrapper" tabindex="-1"> <div class="forum-nav-refine-bar"> <label class="forum-nav-filter-main"> <span class="sr">Filter:</span> <select class="forum-nav-filter-main-control"> <option value="all">Show all posts</option> <option value="unread">Unread posts</option> <option value="unanswered">Unanswered posts</option> </select> </label><% if (isDiscussionDivisionEnabled && isPrivilegedUser) { %><label class="forum-nav-filter-cohort"> <span class="sr">Group:</span> <select class="forum-nav-filter-cohort-control"> <option value="">in all groups</option> </select> </label><% } %><label data-discussion-id="6431x_1T2020_discussion_ch6-s7-tab6_discussion" data-user-create-comment="true" data-user-create-subcomment="true" data-read-only="false"> <div class="discussion-module-header"> 4 / 6. True or False </div> </div> <button class="discussion-show btn" data-discussion-id="6431x_1T2020_discussion_ch6-s7-tab6_discussion" > <span class="button-text">Show Discussion</span> </button> </div> <script type="text/javascript"> var $$course_id = "course\u002Dv1:MITx+6.431x+1T2020"; function DiscussionInlineBlock(runtime, element) { 'use strict'; var el = $(element).find('.discussion-module'); new DiscussionInlineView({ el: el, readOnly: el.data('read-only') }); } </script> </div> </div> </div> </div>
Audit Access Expires May 27, 2020
You lose all access to this course, including your progress, on May 27, 2020.

5. Indicator variables

Problem 5. Indicator variables

5/6 points (graded)

Consider a sequence of 𝑛+1 independent tosses of a biased coin, at times 𝑘=0,1,2,…,𝑛. On each toss, the probability of Heads is 𝑝, and the probability of Tails is 1−𝑝.

A reward of one unit is given at time 𝑘, for 𝑘∈{1,2,…,𝑛}, if the toss at time 𝑘 resulted in Tails and the toss at time 𝑘−1 resulted in Heads. Otherwise, no reward is given at time 𝑘.

Let 𝑅 be the sum of the rewards collected at times 1,2,…,𝑛.

We will find 𝐄[𝑅] and 𝖵𝖺𝗋(𝑅) by carrying out a sequence of steps. Express your answers below in terms of 𝑝 and/or 𝑛 using standard notation (available through the “STANDARD NOTATION" button below.) Remember to write "*" for all multiplications and to include parentheses where necessary.

We first work towards finding 𝐄[𝑅].

1. Let 𝐼𝑘 denote the reward (possibly 0) given at time 𝑘, for 𝑘∈{1,2,…,𝑛}. Find 𝐄[𝐼𝑘].

𝐄[𝐼𝑘]=

correct

p*(1-p)

𝑝⋅(1−𝑝)

2. Using the answer to part 1, find 𝐄[𝑅].

𝐄[𝑅]=

correct

n*p*(1-p)

𝑛⋅𝑝⋅(1−𝑝)

The variance calculation is more involved because the random variables 𝐼1,𝐼2,…,𝐼𝑛 are not independent. We begin by computing the following values.

3. If 𝑘∈{1,2,…,𝑛}, then

𝐄[𝐼2𝑘]=

correct

p*(1-p)

𝑝⋅(1−𝑝)

4. If 𝑘∈{1,2,…,𝑛−1}, then

𝐄[𝐼𝑘𝐼𝑘+1]=

correct

0

0

5. If 𝑘≥1, ℓ≥2, and 𝑘+ℓ≤𝑛, then

𝐄[𝐼𝑘𝐼𝑘+ℓ]=

correct

p^2*(1-p)^2

𝑝2⋅(1−𝑝)2

6. Using the results above, calculate the numerical value of 𝖵𝖺𝗋(𝑅), assuming that 𝑝=3/4, 𝑛=10.

𝖵𝖺𝗋(𝑅)=

incorrect

0.890625

STANDARD NOTATION

Standard Notation

×
Guidelines Example Entries Common mistakes
Symbols These are case sensitive.
Use the correct case as specified in the problem.		 n and N are different. Do NOT enter x for X
Parentheses Match each open parenthesis with a close parenthesis.
Elementary arithmetic operations Use the symbols +,-,*,/ for addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division, respectively. Enter 1+b*c-d/e for 1+𝑏𝑐−𝑑/𝑒
For multiplication, use * explicitly.
Although the ''pretty'' display underneath your answer looks correct if you do not include * s, your answer will be marked incorrect! 		Enter b*c for 𝑏𝑐 in the example above
Enter 2*n*(n+1) for 2𝑛(𝑛+1) 		Do NOT enter bc for 𝑏𝑐
Do NOT enter 2n(n+1) for 2𝑛(𝑛+1)
Exponents Use the symbol ^ to denote exponentiation. Enter 2^n for 2𝑛
Enter x^(n+1) for 𝑥𝑛+1
Square root use the string of letters sqrt, followed by enclosing what is under the square root in parentheses. Enter sqrt(-1) for −1‾‾‾√
Mathematical
constants 		Use the symbol e for the base of the natural logarithm, 𝑒.
Use the string of letters pi for 𝜋. 		Enter e^(i*(pi))+1 for 𝑒𝑖𝜋+1
Order of operations 1) parentheses
2) exponents and roots
3) multiplication and division
4) addition and subtraction
When in doubt, use additional parentheses to remove possible ambiguitites. 		Enter a/b*c for 𝑎𝑏⋅𝑐
Enter a/(b*c) for 𝑎𝑏𝑐
Enter (1/sqrt(2*(pi)))*e^(-(x^2)/2) for 12𝜋‾‾‾√𝑒−𝑥22
Do NOT enter a/b*c for 𝑎𝑏𝑐
Natural logarithm Although in lectures and solved problems we will sometimes use the notation ''log'' (instead of ''ln''), you should use the string of letters ln, followed by the argument enclosed in parentheses. Enter ln(2*x) for ln(2𝑥) Do NOT enter log(2*x) for ln(2𝑥)
Trigonometric
functions 		Use the usual 3-letter symbols to denote the standard trigonometric functions Enter sin(x) for sin(𝑥) Do NOT enter sin x for sin(𝑥)
Greek letters Use the Latin-character name to denote each Greek letter Enter lambda*e^(-lambda*t) for 𝜆𝑒−𝜆𝑡
Enter mu*alpha*theta for 𝑚𝑢𝛼𝜃
Factorials, permutations, combinations You will not need enter these for any symbolic answers. Do NOT use ! in your answers as it will not be evaluated correctly!
Close Guide

Solution:

  1. Since 𝐼𝑘 is a Bernoulli indicator variable and the tosses are independent, we have

    𝐄[𝐼𝑘]=𝐏(𝐼𝑘=1)=𝐏(Tails at time 𝑘 and Heads at time 𝑘−1)=𝑝(1−𝑝).
    		  

  2. The total reward over all the tosses, 𝑅, is the sum of all the 𝐼𝑘's, for 𝑘=1,2,…,𝑛. By linearity of expectations, we have

    𝐄[𝑅]=𝐄[∑𝑘=1𝑛𝐼𝑘]=∑𝑘=1𝑛𝐄[𝐼𝑘]=𝑛𝑝(1−𝑝).
    		  

  3. Since 𝐼𝑘 can be only 0 or 1, 𝐄[𝐼2𝑘]=𝐄[𝐼𝑘]=𝑝(1−𝑝).

  4. 𝐼𝑘𝐼𝑘+1 equals 1 if 𝐼𝑘=1 and 𝐼𝑘+1=1, i.e., if a reward was given at time 𝑘 and at time 𝑘+1. Otherwise, 𝐼𝑘𝐼𝑘+1 equals 0. But 𝐼𝑘 and 𝐼𝑘+1 cannot both equal 1: 𝐼𝑘=1 implies that the toss at time 𝑘 resulted in Tails, while 𝐼𝑘+1=1 implies that the toss at time 𝑘 resulted in Heads. Hence, it is not possible to obtain a reward at consecutive times 𝑘 and 𝑘+1. Therefore, 𝐄[𝐼𝑘𝐼𝑘+1]=0.

  5. Part 4 above considered the rewards at two consecutive times. We now consider the rewards at two times that are at least 2 periods apart. Since the reward at time 𝑘 depends only on the tosses at times 𝑘 and 𝑘−1, the rewards at times that are at least 2 periods apart depend on different, non-overlapping pairs of coin tosses, and hence 𝐼𝑘 and 𝐼𝑘+ℓ are independent for ℓ≥2. Therefore, 𝐄[𝐼𝑘𝐼𝑘+ℓ]=𝐄[𝐼𝑘]𝐄[𝐼𝑘+ℓ]=𝑝2(1−𝑝)2 for the values of 𝑘 and ℓ specified in the problem statement for this part.

  6. From Part 2, we have already calculated 𝐄[𝑅]. We now find 𝐄[𝑅2] and use the identity 𝖵𝖺𝗋(𝑅)=𝐄[𝑅2]−(𝐄[𝑅])2.

    𝐄[𝑅2]=𝐄[(∑𝑘=1𝑛𝐼𝑘)(∑𝑚=1𝑛𝐼𝑚)]=𝐄[∑𝑘=1𝑛∑𝑚=1𝑛𝐼𝑘𝐼𝑚]=∑𝑘=1𝑛∑𝑚=1𝑛𝐄[𝐼𝑘𝐼𝑚]
    		  

    There are 𝑛2 terms in this double summation. We can divide them into three groups:

    1. There are 𝑛 terms where 𝑘=𝑚. From Part 3, we know that 𝐄[𝐼𝑘𝐼𝑚]=𝑝(1−𝑝) for this case.

    2. There are 𝑛−1 terms where 𝑘=𝑚+1 and another 𝑛−1 terms where 𝑚=𝑘+1. From Part 4, we know that 𝐄[𝐼𝑘𝐼𝑚]=0 for these cases.

    3. The remaining 𝑛2−𝑛−2(𝑛−1)=𝑛2−3𝑛+2 terms are those where 𝑘 and 𝑚 differ by at least 2. From Part 5, we know that 𝐄[𝐼𝑘𝐼𝑚]=𝑝2(1−𝑝)2 for these cases.

    Putting these cases together, we have

    𝐄[𝑅2]=𝑛⋅𝑝(1−𝑝)+2(𝑛−1)⋅0+(𝑛2−3𝑛+2)⋅𝑝2(1−𝑝)2.
    		  

    Therefore,

      𝖵𝖺𝗋(𝑅) =𝐄[𝑅2]−(𝐄[𝑅])2    
        =𝑛𝑝(1−𝑝)+(𝑛2−3𝑛+2)𝑝2(1−𝑝)2−𝑛2𝑝2(1−𝑝)2    
        =𝑛𝑝(1−𝑝)−(3𝑛−2)𝑝2(1−𝑝)2.    

    When 𝑝=3/4 and 𝑛=10, we obtain 𝖵𝖺𝗋(𝑅)=57/64=0.890625.

You have used 2 of 5 attempts Some problems have options such as save, reset, hints, or show answer. These options follow the Submit button.
None
Answers are displayed within the problem

      Are we expected to learn mathjax for this course?
      Are we expected to learn mathjax for this course? A lot of people posting questions or answers in the discussions are using mathjax notation instead of standard notation. This is utterly helpless to those who do not know mathjax notation. Are we expected to learn it for this course? If not, what is the benefit of people posting in mathjax notation? I'm unclear on this. I would see a point to mathjax notation if the Edx app was posting it properly, but it doesn't do that for the discussions, at least not on my app. Can someone please clarify?

    • discussion
      It think there's an error
      For n tosses, there cannot be n possible 1's since I sub 1 cannot = 1; that would imply that there was an I sub 0, which is not the case. Therefore there can only be( n-1) possible 1's. This threw me at the beginning when I wrote that 𝐄[𝑅] = (n-1)*p*(p-1), which was graded as wrong.

    • discussion
      problem with Part 2
      As I understand Part 2, we are looking for R, the expected cumulative reward. However, from the problem as described, the reward at any time k is dependent on the reward at time k-1. It is impossible to get two rewards in a row, because if we get a reward at time k-1, then we cannot get one also at time k. But how do we calculate the reward at time k if we don't know whether a reward was given at time k-1. Am I overthinking this? Any assistance on this part would be greatly appreciated.
      +0 votes 5 comments (5 unread comments)

    • discussion
      k should start from 2
      when k = 1, it means whether the first toss should be reward or not, obviously there is no toss before the first toss, so the scenario of H (0th toss) followed with T(1st toss) would never appear, thus I_1 must equals to 0

    • unanswered question
      [Staff] If there is a mistake in the question? when k = 1, k - 1 = 0, I_k = 0, because there is not 0th toss
      A reward of one unit is given at time k , for k∈{1,2,…,n} , if the toss at time k resulted in Tails and the toss at time k−1 (**maybe here should be k+1?**) resulted in Heads. Otherwise, no reward is given at time k . update: I work it out with the correction on my own, just remind others
      +0 votes 1 new 4 comments (2 unread comments)
